{{cpp/io/basic_filebuf/title | showmanyc }}
{{cpp/io/basic_filebuf/navbar}}
{{ddcl |
protected:
virtual std::streamsize showmanyc()
}}

If implemented, returns the number of characters left to read from the file.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
The number of characters available for reading from the file, or {{c|-1}} if the end of file was reached.

===Notes===
This function is optional. If not implemented, this function returns {{c|0}} (since the base class version {{c|std::basic_streambuf::showmanyc}} gets called)

Whether implemented or not, this function is normally called by {{c|std::basic_streambuf::in_avail}} if the get area is empty.

The name of this function stands for "stream: how many characters?", so it is pronounced "S how many C", rather than "show many C"

===Example===
{{example
 | implementation test to see if showmanyc() is implemented for filebuf
 | code=
#include &lt;fstream&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

struct mybuf : std::filebuf
{
     using std::filebuf::showmanyc;
};

int main()
{
    mybuf fin;
    fin.open("main.cpp", std::ios_base::in);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "showmanyc() returns " &lt;&lt; fin.showmanyc() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
| output=
showmanyc() returns 267
}}
